output_list.reason: The multiplication operation in the SafeMath library can lead to an integer overflow if the result is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.
The division operation in the SafeMath library can lead to an integer overflow if the divisor is zero or if the result is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.
The subtraction operation in the SafeMath library can lead to an integer overflow if the result is less than zero.
The addition operation in the SafeMath library can lead to an integer overflow if the result is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in a uint256 variable.
The transfer function does not check if the sender has enough balance to transfer the specified amount. This can lead to unauthorized transfers.
